elements.title: Franzisca Baruch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Franzisca Baruch (pictured) designed several Hebrew fonts, the cover of the first Israeli passport, the emblem of Jerusalem, and the logo of the Ha'aretz newspaper, all while barely knowing Hebrew?

elements.title: Come Back Home (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the song "Come Back Home" by Seo Taiji and Boys made teenage runaways in South Korea return home?

elements.title: Linda Albertini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Italian actress Linda Albertini used her abilities as a former circus acrobat in silent films?

elements.title: Joice Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joice Island was the location of a "web of intrigue" in 1890, a failed asparagus farm in 1905, a wildlife refuge in 1950, a hunting preserve in 1965, and a pig hunt in 2017?

elements.title: Arthur Bronwell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that under college president Arthur Bronwell in 1959, Worcester Polytechnic Institute built one of the first nuclear research reactors at an American university?

elements.title: the crossover between (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a YouTuber predicted the crossover between My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic and Rick and Morty long before it aired?

elements.title: Bob Ferguson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that baseball statistician Bob Ferguson claimed that he became the owner of the London Majors "by accident"?

elements.title: Zzzzzz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zzzzzz had the busiest residential telephone number in the United States in the 1970s?
